As discussed, kindly find below the positive response from insurer who has agreed to :

 

 

1.	Amend the BOV from Cost +10% to Cost +15%.
2.	Amend the Minimum of Deposit Premium for Sendings to USD 4,780 from USD 5,000 – which makes the total premium due at inception USD 15,000.

Kev

Thank you so much for your call today.

 

As discussed, MDP for the cargo insurance is very high. We would need to have USD 14,000,000 annual turnover based on cost value to consume the MDP which is unrealistic. 

 

The total retail value of the insured products declared is USD 11M. If we were to sell everything, the estimated cost to replace the sold products would be approximately USD 5.5M. Given these figures, the MDP of USD 5,000 is not be justified.

 

Let us please conclude this exercise and have cover in place with the below amendments to the latest proposal:

 

*	MDP for Sendings: USD 3,000 (instead of USD 5,000) 
*	Valuation provisions: 

	*	Insured’s Own Stock: Cost Price + 20% or Replacement Value, whichever is higher (instead of Cost Price + 10%)
	*	Sendings: Cost Price + 20% or Replacement Value, whichever is higher (instead of Cost Price + 10%)

*	All other terms as per the latest proposal

 

You may proceed and bind cover effective Feb 1, 2025 subject to the above amendments.

 

Thank you once again for your kind support.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

We also attach the updated slip for your review and comments .

 

Looking forward to hearing from you in order to finalize .

Best regards, 

Kev

 

We have spoken with insurers, and now provided an updated quote slip for your review. 

 

Firstly, the Basis of Valuation cannot be amended to be Retail Sales Price. The core principle of insurance is to restore the insured to their financial position prior to the loss, not to provide a profit. Insuring Chalhoub’s jewellery at retail price can lead to over-insurance, where the payout exceeds the actual value of the item. Insuring at retail price could result in the insured receiving more than what they lost, which is contrary to the principle of indemnity. This Basis of Valuation is not possible in the insurance market. 

 

Secondly, we have amended the limit for Location 2 to USD 2,000,000 and similarly amended the Static Premium to USD 6,720 (100%) in full per annum, which amend the Total Premium Due at Inception to USD 15,220 (100%) in full per annum. 

 

Thirdly, insurers require that the Minimum and Deposit premium of USD 5,000 remains as stated in the initial quotation. 

 

Finally, the Exhibition limit needs to be aggregated in the policy. If the Insured requires additional static cover, they can purchase more limit at the same rate of 0.03% subject to prior agreement by lead underwriters.

SUBJECTIVITIES / IMPORTANT TERMS

*	For the Insured’s Own Stock is Cost Price plus 10% or Replacement Value whichever is the highest.
*	For Goods given on Approval is Entrustment Note Value for entrustments to/by the assured.
*	For Goods sold is Selling Price for goods sold but not delivered.

However, in respect of exhibitions, we must receive confirmation that during the exhibitions the jewellery will be maintained within the following guidelines:

1.	Never be left unattended, for any reason whatsoever, whilst on display during Exhibition hours
2.	At all times be kept in locked showcases, cabinets, drawers and/or safes whilst on display during Exhibition hours, unless being removed or returned to such showcases, drawers and/or safes.
3.	Be kept in a locked safe/vault or approved security room at all times when not being displayed. 

 

I know the Insured is actively chasing for a formal quotation, but as this is a new risk to the Market, we need to get this correct. Please note we hope to have something concrete with you shortly.

Dear Hagop ,

 

We hope you are well .

 

Based in our earlier conversation today , We are pleased to confirm  that we now have received a very rough indication from insurers for Jeweler’s Block cover as per below  details :

 

The overall premium indication is USD 13,500 (100% RI support ).

 

USD 5,000 of the above premium will be assigned to a Minimum and Deposit Premium in relation to armoured Transits, which will be adjustable at a premium rate of 0.035% on annual turnover. This also includes USD 200,000 any one loss, any one entrustment limit, with a built-in provision to increase this limit to USD 2 million for Royal Family entrustments based on a premium rate of 0.15% per entrustment but subject to prior agreement by Underwriters.

 

For full clarity, any entrusted goods must be from the stock sum insured at retail locations we are covering, unless otherwise agreed by underwriters, and based on a written consignment agreement which specifies who is responsible for the goods and when they should be returned.

Kindly note that our team in London had several  initial conversations with insurers, and some questions have been raised. For full clarity, insurers are aware that there are time constraints both on Chalhoub
Group which are naturally cascaded down to Marsh.

 

Please see below questions and comments for you much appreciate consideration and support :

 

*	Are there any more locations that has Chalhoub exposure? If so, do these also require cover?
*	On what basis is Chalhoub Group responsible for insuring these locations? The locations are well known brands i.e. Saks/Repossi that would normally insure through their own programme? Please can you confirm why the stores are not covering the jewellery?
*	When the jewellery is being entrusted to members of the Royal Family, without a Chalhoub representative, are the entrustments being sent from one of the below detailed Named Locations, or from a separate location? What is the maximum value of the jewellery being entrusted to the Royal Family at any one time. In addition, are there written consignment agreements in place?
*	Please can you confirm the annual transit turnover? What firm will be undertaking the transits?
*	At what point will this Jewellery Block policy be on risk for the transits? Would we be covering the jewellery at the moment it arrives in the Middle East, or are international transits also covered?

*  No Fidelity insurance needed (covered separately)

o   Special Circumstances:

*  Coverage for sending jewelry to royals and while in possession of representatives under pre-agreed ad-hoc terms, including:

*  Minimum security requirements

*  Coverage duration limitations

*  Procedural requirements

*       Note

o   Currently, there is no requirement for jewelry insurance in Kuwait. However, this may change in the future.

 

A full list of entity names, related documents, and KYC requirements will be provided upon finalization of the agreement.

 

Please provide a quotation by early next week so we can discuss further as needed and finalize.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

Dear Hagop ,

 

I hope you’re well . It was great speaking with you yesterday .

 

As per the London Specie Team’s request could you kindly confirm the following ?

 

*	The limits of liability required by  the group(all regions )
*	A full list of the locations that require cover.
*	The minimum security and fire protections at the locations – including at day time and night time.
*	Confirmation of the value being taken outside the store when the Insured’s representatives show items at the clients residences.
*	 Confirmation of any transit cover that is required.
*	Further details about the items that require cover.

 

When we have this information, we can discuss further, and maybe setup another call?

 

We look forward to hearing from you soon .

 

Kind regards,

Kev

Thank you so much for your call today.

 

As discussed, MDP for the cargo insurance is very high. We would need to have USD 14,000,000 annual turnover based on cost value to consume the MDP which is unrealistic. 

 

The total retail value of the insured products declared is USD 11M. If we were to sell everything, the estimated cost to replace the sold products would be approximately USD 5.5M. Given these figures, the MDP of USD 5,000 is not be justified.

 

Let us please conclude this exercise and have cover in place with the below amendments to the latest proposal:

 

*	MDP for Sendings: USD 3,000 (instead of USD 5,000) 
*	Valuation provisions: 

	*	Insured’s Own Stock: Cost Price + 20% or Replacement Value, whichever is higher (instead of Cost Price + 10%)
	*	Sendings: Cost Price + 20% or Replacement Value, whichever is higher (instead of Cost Price + 10%)

*	All other terms as per the latest proposal

 

You may proceed and bind cover effective Feb 1, 2025 subject to the above amendments.

 

Thank you once again for your kind support.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

I hope you’re well.

 

Please find the final comments from our JB/Species team in blue here below following discussions with the market .

We also attach the updated slip for your review and comments .

 

Looking forward to hearing from you in order to finalize .

Best regards, 

Kev

 

We have spoken with insurers, and now provided an updated quote slip for your review. 

 

Firstly, the Basis of Valuation cannot be amended to be Retail Sales Price. The core principle of insurance is to restore the insured to their financial position prior to the loss, not to provide a profit. Insuring Chalhoub’s jewellery at retail price can lead to over-insurance, where the payout exceeds the actual value of the item. Insuring at retail price could result in the insured receiving more than what they lost, which is contrary to the principle of indemnity. This Basis of Valuation is not possible in the insurance market. 

 

Secondly, we have amended the limit for Location 2 to USD 2,000,000 and similarly amended the Static Premium to USD 6,720 (100%) in full per annum, which amend the Total Premium Due at Inception to USD 15,220 (100%) in full per annum. 

 

Thirdly, insurers require that the Minimum and Deposit premium of USD 5,000 remains as stated in the initial quotation. 

 

Finally, the Exhibition limit needs to be aggregated in the policy. If the Insured requires additional static cover, they can purchase more limit at the same rate of 0.03% subject to prior agreement by lead underwriters.

Thank you so much for your call today.

 

As discussed, MDP for the cargo insurance is very high. We would need to have USD 14,000,000 annual turnover based on cost value to consume the MDP which is unrealistic. 

 

The total retail value of the insured products declared is USD 11M. If we were to sell everything, the estimated cost to replace the sold products would be approximately USD 5.5M. Given these figures, the MDP of USD 5,000 is not be justified.

 

Let us please conclude this exercise and have cover in place with the below amendments to the latest proposal:

 

*	MDP for Sendings: USD 3,000 (instead of USD 5,000) 
*	Valuation provisions: 

	*	Insured’s Own Stock: Cost Price + 20% or Replacement Value, whichever is higher (instead of Cost Price + 10%)
	*	Sendings: Cost Price + 20% or Replacement Value, whichever is higher (instead of Cost Price + 10%)

*	All other terms as per the latest proposal

 

You may proceed and bind cover effective Feb 1, 2025 subject to the above amendments.

 

Thank you once again for your kind support.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

chunks.text:
We also attach the updated slip for your review and comments .

 

Looking forward to hearing from you in order to finalize .

Best regards, 

Kev

 

We have spoken with insurers, and now provided an updated quote slip for your review. 

 

Firstly, the Basis of Valuation cannot be amended to be Retail Sales Price. The core principle of insurance is to restore the insured to their financial position prior to the loss, not to provide a profit. Insuring Chalhoub’s jewellery at retail price can lead to over-insurance, where the payout exceeds the actual value of the item. Insuring at retail price could result in the insured receiving more than what they lost, which is contrary to the principle of indemnity. This Basis of Valuation is not possible in the insurance market. 

 

Secondly, we have amended the limit for Location 2 to USD 2,000,000 and similarly amended the Static Premium to USD 6,720 (100%) in full per annum, which amend the Total Premium Due at Inception to USD 15,220 (100%) in full per annum. 

 

Thirdly, insurers require that the Minimum and Deposit premium of USD 5,000 remains as stated in the initial quotation. 

 

Finally, the Exhibition limit needs to be aggregated in the policy. If the Insured requires additional static cover, they can purchase more limit at the same rate of 0.03% subject to prior agreement by lead underwriters.

Dear Hagop , 

 

I hope you are well and apologies for the delay in receiving the fully supported JB  quotation, which is now attached. 

Please note that with new risks into the London Market there is a slightly lengthier process required to get to quotation stage. 

 

 

PREMIUM

The Total Premium Due at Inception is USD 17,000 (100%) in full per annum, plus VAT and  applicable local taxes. 


The above premium includes a USD 5,000 Minimum and Deposit premium for Sendings, which is adjusted on expiry at a rate of 0.035% on transit turnover. In addition, any Celebrity , VIP or  Royal Family entrustments are to be adjusted at a rate of 0.15%. And although the policy allows for an Exhibition limit of USD 1,500,000 and USD 5,000,000 in the annual aggregate, any additional Exhibitions are to be adjusted at a rate of 0.09%.

 

MARKET SELECTION

The above premium includes a USD 5,000 Minimum and Deposit premium for Sendings, which is adjusted on expiry at a rate of 0.035% on transit turnover. In addition, any Celebrity , VIP or  Royal Family entrustments are to be adjusted at a rate of 0.15%. And although the policy allows for an Exhibition limit of USD 1,500,000 and USD 5,000,000 in the annual aggregate, any additional Exhibitions are to be adjusted at a rate of 0.09%.

 

MARKET SELECTION

We approached several  lead carrier for terms and  Tokio Marine Kiln was the most competitive with follow markets’ share stated in attached RI slip .

This lead market was selected based upon the following criteria: competitive pricing / claims service / access to capacity / commercially responsive / sector knowledge.

 

MARSH UK COMPENSATION AND PLACEMENT STATEMENT  

Please see Marsh Compensation and Placement Description document (MCPD)  attached for full descriptions of the terms in bold below.

 

Placement:

This placement or part thereof is placed under a Lineslip.

 

LIMIT(S) / RETENTION(S)

The Limit(s) / Retention(s) provided are detailed in the attached quote.

 

SUBJECTIVITIES / IMPORTANT TERMS

Whilst we recommend that you review the attached quotation in full, we would like to draw your attention to the following.

 

The Basis of Valuation is as follows:

*	For the Insured’s Own Stock is Cost Price plus 10% or Replacement Value whichever is the highest.
*	For Goods given on Approval is Entrustment Note Value for entrustments to/by the assured.
*	For Goods sold is Selling Price for goods sold but not delivered.

Dear Hagop,

 

I hope you are well .

 

Please find the below comments/query from our London Team .

 

We count on your understanding and look forward to receiving your final in order to obtain and formal binding indication from the RI market .

 

Kindest regards,

Kev

 

 

Apologies for this taking some time – for completely new risks into the London Market there is a process to make sure all everything is underwritten correctly.  

 

I know in your previous email you raised that some celebrities are entrusted items for events etc. The insurer needs to know about the values given to these celebrities – will this be on the same basis as the entrustments, i.e. USD 200k? In addition, would there be any overnight exposure, and will this only be in KSA, UAE and Bahrain?

I know in your previous email you raised that some celebrities are entrusted items for events etc. The insurer needs to know about the values given to these celebrities – will this be on the same basis as the entrustments, i.e. USD 200k? In addition, would there be any overnight exposure, and will this only be in KSA, UAE and Bahrain?  

 

In addition, in your previous email you mentioned that for home visits and for exhibitions where values less than USD 1.5M (retail) will be exhibited, the products are generally transferred by the brand director or relevant employees. For personal conveyances of this scale, there would be an Additional Premium of USD 2,000, and require two people in attendance, one being the brand director plus an experienced member of staff.

 

In respect of the exhibitions, would a limit of USD 500,000, and USD 1.5 million in the annual aggregate be sufficient? From your previous exhibition history, it looks as though Chalhoub undertake 3 exhibitions a year of that value. Insurers are willing to provide cover for these exhibitions and provided two options. Option 1 – static cover only at an Additional Premium of USD 450. Option 2 – static cover and armoured transit cover at an Additional Premium of USD 600. 

 

However, in respect of exhibitions, we must receive confirmation that during the exhibitions the jewellery will be maintained within the following guidelines:

In respect of the exhibitions, would a limit of USD 500,000, and USD 1.5 million in the annual aggregate be sufficient? From your previous exhibition history, it looks as though Chalhoub undertake 3 exhibitions a year of that value. Insurers are willing to provide cover for these exhibitions and provided two options. Option 1 – static cover only at an Additional Premium of USD 450. Option 2 – static cover and armoured transit cover at an Additional Premium of USD 600. 

 

However, in respect of exhibitions, we must receive confirmation that during the exhibitions the jewellery will be maintained within the following guidelines:

1.	Never be left unattended, for any reason whatsoever, whilst on display during Exhibition hours
2.	At all times be kept in locked showcases, cabinets, drawers and/or safes whilst on display during Exhibition hours, unless being removed or returned to such showcases, drawers and/or safes.
3.	Be kept in a locked safe/vault or approved security room at all times when not being displayed. 

 

I know the Insured is actively chasing for a formal quotation, but as this is a new risk to the Market, we need to get this correct. Please note we hope to have something concrete with you shortly.

Dear Hagop ,

 

We hope you are well .

 

Based in our earlier conversation today , We are pleased to confirm  that we now have received a very rough indication from insurers for Jeweler’s Block cover as per below  details :

 

The overall premium indication is USD 13,500 (100% RI support ).

 

USD 5,000 of the above premium will be assigned to a Minimum and Deposit Premium in relation to armoured Transits, which will be adjustable at a premium rate of 0.035% on annual turnover. This also includes USD 200,000 any one loss, any one entrustment limit, with a built-in provision to increase this limit to USD 2 million for Royal Family entrustments based on a premium rate of 0.15% per entrustment but subject to prior agreement by Underwriters.

 

For full clarity, any entrusted goods must be from the stock sum insured at retail locations we are covering, unless otherwise agreed by underwriters, and based on a written consignment agreement which specifies who is responsible for the goods and when they should be returned.

For full clarity, any entrusted goods must be from the stock sum insured at retail locations we are covering, unless otherwise agreed by underwriters, and based on a written consignment agreement which specifies who is responsible for the goods and when they should be returned.

 

If this indication is of interest, please let us know and we will provide a formal quotation A.S.AP.

 

Thank you and kind regards,

 

Kev

CAUTION: This email originated outside the company. Do not click links or open attachments unless you are expecting them from the sender.

 

Dear Kevork,

Please find the requested details below:

 

*	Are there any more locations that has Chalhoub exposure? If so, do these also require cover? 

	*	No

*	On what basis is Chalhoub Group responsible for insuring these locations? The locations are well known brands i.e. Saks/Repossi that would normally insure through their own programme? Please can you confirm why the stores are not covering the jewellery? 

	*	The PAR has an exclusion for Jewellery. Our main categories are Fashion and Beauty products

*	When the jewellery is being entrusted to members of the Royal Family, without a Chalhoub representative, are the entrustments being sent from one of the below detailed Named Locations, or from a separate location? What is the maximum value of the jewellery being entrusted to the Royal Family at any one time. In addition, are there written consignment agreements in place?

chunks.text:
*	When the jewellery is being entrusted to members of the Royal Family, without a Chalhoub representative, are the entrustments being sent from one of the below detailed Named Locations, or from a separate location? What is the maximum value of the jewellery being entrusted to the Royal Family at any one time. In addition, are there written consignment agreements in place? 

	*	Maximum should be around: USD 2M
	*	No existing consignment agreements in place or even expected for the time being.
	*	There may be some ultra luxury pieces that are brought in from time to time that may be exhibited to royals if the chance arises. (Examples: https://www.debeers.co.uk/en-gb/couture.html <https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Furl.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com%2Fs%2FMCi_CN5zAUVALknUMCVSysgmG%3Fdomain%3Durldefense.com&data=05%7C02%7Chagop.ghazarian%40chalhoub.com%7C308b4ce686b94a911ea208dd41b2f11a%7C6ef8304cf37b42a5a5690a7d8249fbf3%7C0%7C0%7C638738959022800991%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=XQj592ZEf%2BMpIT9bShRRkAtyR12l8clFE5MQxqXEfyw%3D&reserved=0> )
	*	There is planned visit as of the moment. However, we would like to have a pre-agreed ad hoc rate up to predefined levels of coverage, procedural requirements and time limitations that the underwriters would be comfortable with.

*	Please can you confirm the annual transit turnover? What firm will be undertaking the transits?

*	At what point will this Jewellery Block policy be on risk for the transits? Would we be covering the jewellery at the moment it arrives in the Middle East, or are international transits also covered? 

	*	International transit from the moment of leaving the supplier and recovery can be made from the supplier if possible based on the incoterms.

 

Remain at your disposal for any further details required.


Best Regards,

Hagop

Kindly note that our team in London had several  initial conversations with insurers, and some questions have been raised. For full clarity, insurers are aware that there are time constraints both on Chalhoub
Group which are naturally cascaded down to Marsh.

 

Please see below questions and comments for you much appreciate consideration and support :

 

*	Are there any more locations that has Chalhoub exposure? If so, do these also require cover?
*	On what basis is Chalhoub Group responsible for insuring these locations? The locations are well known brands i.e. Saks/Repossi that would normally insure through their own programme? Please can you confirm why the stores are not covering the jewellery?
*	When the jewellery is being entrusted to members of the Royal Family, without a Chalhoub representative, are the entrustments being sent from one of the below detailed Named Locations, or from a separate location? What is the maximum value of the jewellery being entrusted to the Royal Family at any one time. In addition, are there written consignment agreements in place?
*	Please can you confirm the annual transit turnover? What firm will be undertaking the transits?
*	At what point will this Jewellery Block policy be on risk for the transits? Would we be covering the jewellery at the moment it arrives in the Middle East, or are international transits also covered?

o   UAE

*  Dubai Mall – De Beers

*  Galleria Mall – Repossi

o   KSA

*  Kingdom Mall – Repossi

o   Bahrain

*  Bahrain City Center – Multibrand (located within our department store, Saks Fifth Avenue - BCC)

*       Minimum Security and Fire Protections at Each Location

o   Fire Safety:

*  Smoke detectors

*  Sprinkler systems covering all areas

*  Fire-rated materials installed per civil defence guidelines (compliant)

o   Maintenance:

*  Routine maintenance for electrical systems, firefighting (FF), and HVAC

o   Security:

*  Dedicated security personnel during business hours

*  Mall security outside of business hours

*  Full CCTV coverage

*  Intrusion alarms

*       Value of Items Transported Outside the Store

o   Amount: USD 50,000 to USD 200,000 per client, depending on the sales price

*       Transit Coverage Requirements

o   Local Transit:

*  Coverage up to USD 2,000,000 (based on sales price)

*  Preferably with a minimum premium and an adjustable premium based on actual imported values

*       Additional Coverage Details

o   Shoplifting Protection

o   Consignment Goods:

*  In Bahrain, we sell other jewelry brands based on a consignment agreement model. The same model applies to UAE and KSA.

*  Potential future consignment sales at Level Shoes District in Dubai Mall (confirmation pending)

o   Exclusions:

Dear Hagop ,

 

I hope you’re well . It was great speaking with you yesterday .

 

As per the London Specie Team’s request could you kindly confirm the following ?

 

*	The limits of liability required by  the group(all regions )
*	A full list of the locations that require cover.
*	The minimum security and fire protections at the locations – including at day time and night time.
*	Confirmation of the value being taken outside the store when the Insured’s representatives show items at the clients residences.
*	 Confirmation of any transit cover that is required.
*	Further details about the items that require cover.

 

When we have this information, we can discuss further, and maybe setup another call?

 

We look forward to hearing from you soon .

 

Kind regards,

Kev

chunks.text:
Thank you so much for your call today.

 

As discussed, MDP for the cargo insurance is very high. We would need to have USD 14,000,000 annual turnover based on cost value to consume the MDP which is unrealistic. 

 

The total retail value of the insured products declared is USD 11M. If we were to sell everything, the estimated cost to replace the sold products would be approximately USD 5.5M. Given these figures, the MDP of USD 5,000 is not be justified.

 

Let us please conclude this exercise and have cover in place with the below amendments to the latest proposal:

 

*	MDP for Sendings: USD 3,000 (instead of USD 5,000) 
*	Valuation provisions: 

	*	Insured’s Own Stock: Cost Price + 20% or Replacement Value, whichever is higher (instead of Cost Price + 10%)
	*	Sendings: Cost Price + 20% or Replacement Value, whichever is higher (instead of Cost Price + 10%)

*	All other terms as per the latest proposal

 

You may proceed and bind cover effective Feb 1, 2025 subject to the above amendments.

 

Thank you once again for your kind support.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

chunks.text:
We also attach the updated slip for your review and comments .

 

Looking forward to hearing from you in order to finalize .

Best regards, 

Kev

 

We have spoken with insurers, and now provided an updated quote slip for your review. 

 

Firstly, the Basis of Valuation cannot be amended to be Retail Sales Price. The core principle of insurance is to restore the insured to their financial position prior to the loss, not to provide a profit. Insuring Chalhoub’s jewellery at retail price can lead to over-insurance, where the payout exceeds the actual value of the item. Insuring at retail price could result in the insured receiving more than what they lost, which is contrary to the principle of indemnity. This Basis of Valuation is not possible in the insurance market. 

 

Secondly, we have amended the limit for Location 2 to USD 2,000,000 and similarly amended the Static Premium to USD 6,720 (100%) in full per annum, which amend the Total Premium Due at Inception to USD 15,220 (100%) in full per annum. 

 

Thirdly, insurers require that the Minimum and Deposit premium of USD 5,000 remains as stated in the initial quotation. 

 

Finally, the Exhibition limit needs to be aggregated in the policy. If the Insured requires additional static cover, they can purchase more limit at the same rate of 0.03% subject to prior agreement by lead underwriters.

Dear Hagop , 

 

I hope you are well and apologies for the delay in receiving the fully supported JB  quotation, which is now attached. 

Please note that with new risks into the London Market there is a slightly lengthier process required to get to quotation stage. 

 

 

PREMIUM

The Total Premium Due at Inception is USD 17,000 (100%) in full per annum, plus VAT and  applicable local taxes. 


The above premium includes a USD 5,000 Minimum and Deposit premium for Sendings, which is adjusted on expiry at a rate of 0.035% on transit turnover. In addition, any Celebrity , VIP or  Royal Family entrustments are to be adjusted at a rate of 0.15%. And although the policy allows for an Exhibition limit of USD 1,500,000 and USD 5,000,000 in the annual aggregate, any additional Exhibitions are to be adjusted at a rate of 0.09%.

 

MARKET SELECTION

The above premium includes a USD 5,000 Minimum and Deposit premium for Sendings, which is adjusted on expiry at a rate of 0.035% on transit turnover. In addition, any Celebrity , VIP or  Royal Family entrustments are to be adjusted at a rate of 0.15%. And although the policy allows for an Exhibition limit of USD 1,500,000 and USD 5,000,000 in the annual aggregate, any additional Exhibitions are to be adjusted at a rate of 0.09%.

 

MARKET SELECTION

We approached several  lead carrier for terms and  Tokio Marine Kiln was the most competitive with follow markets’ share stated in attached RI slip .

This lead market was selected based upon the following criteria: competitive pricing / claims service / access to capacity / commercially responsive / sector knowledge.

 

MARSH UK COMPENSATION AND PLACEMENT STATEMENT  

Please see Marsh Compensation and Placement Description document (MCPD)  attached for full descriptions of the terms in bold below.

 

Placement:

This placement or part thereof is placed under a Lineslip.

 

LIMIT(S) / RETENTION(S)

The Limit(s) / Retention(s) provided are detailed in the attached quote.

 

SUBJECTIVITIES / IMPORTANT TERMS

Whilst we recommend that you review the attached quotation in full, we would like to draw your attention to the following.

 

The Basis of Valuation is as follows:

*	For the Insured’s Own Stock is Cost Price plus 10% or Replacement Value whichever is the highest.
*	For Goods given on Approval is Entrustment Note Value for entrustments to/by the assured.
*	For Goods sold is Selling Price for goods sold but not delivered.

Kindest regards,

Kev

 

 

Apologies for this taking some time – for completely new risks into the London Market there is a process to make sure all everything is underwritten correctly.  

 

I know in your previous email you raised that some celebrities are entrusted items for events etc. The insurer needs to know about the values given to these celebrities – will this be on the same basis as the entrustments, i.e. USD 200k? In addition, would there be any overnight exposure, and will this only be in KSA, UAE and Bahrain?

I know in your previous email you raised that some celebrities are entrusted items for events etc. The insurer needs to know about the values given to these celebrities – will this be on the same basis as the entrustments, i.e. USD 200k? In addition, would there be any overnight exposure, and will this only be in KSA, UAE and Bahrain?  

 

In addition, in your previous email you mentioned that for home visits and for exhibitions where values less than USD 1.5M (retail) will be exhibited, the products are generally transferred by the brand director or relevant employees. For personal conveyances of this scale, there would be an Additional Premium of USD 2,000, and require two people in attendance, one being the brand director plus an experienced member of staff.

 

In respect of the exhibitions, would a limit of USD 500,000, and USD 1.5 million in the annual aggregate be sufficient? From your previous exhibition history, it looks as though Chalhoub undertake 3 exhibitions a year of that value. Insurers are willing to provide cover for these exhibitions and provided two options. Option 1 – static cover only at an Additional Premium of USD 450. Option 2 – static cover and armoured transit cover at an Additional Premium of USD 600. 

 

However, in respect of exhibitions, we must receive confirmation that during the exhibitions the jewellery will be maintained within the following guidelines:

In respect of the exhibitions, would a limit of USD 500,000, and USD 1.5 million in the annual aggregate be sufficient? From your previous exhibition history, it looks as though Chalhoub undertake 3 exhibitions a year of that value. Insurers are willing to provide cover for these exhibitions and provided two options. Option 1 – static cover only at an Additional Premium of USD 450. Option 2 – static cover and armoured transit cover at an Additional Premium of USD 600. 

 

However, in respect of exhibitions, we must receive confirmation that during the exhibitions the jewellery will be maintained within the following guidelines:

1.	Never be left unattended, for any reason whatsoever, whilst on display during Exhibition hours
2.	At all times be kept in locked showcases, cabinets, drawers and/or safes whilst on display during Exhibition hours, unless being removed or returned to such showcases, drawers and/or safes.
3.	Be kept in a locked safe/vault or approved security room at all times when not being displayed. 

 

I know the Insured is actively chasing for a formal quotation, but as this is a new risk to the Market, we need to get this correct. Please note we hope to have something concrete with you shortly.

Hi Kevork,

 

Thank you for the rough indication. However, there are few points that need to be reassessed:

*	The transit insurance cover that we need is when the products are being transferred in either company vehicles or personal vehicles.
*	For home visits and for exhibitions where values less than USD 1.5M (retail) will be exhibited, the products are generally transferred by the brand director or relevant employees
*	Cover is required as well for products at the exhibition locations
*	Clarity is required for the following point:
*	What are the minimum security measures that the underwriters require to be present during exhibtions
*	Process that is necessary prior to handing over jewellery to employees in case of local transfers and/or home visits
*	Process that is necessary for entrustments to middle men for ultra-high net worth clients

Dear Hagop ,

 

We hope you are well .

 

Based in our earlier conversation today , We are pleased to confirm  that we now have received a very rough indication from insurers for Jeweler’s Block cover as per below  details :

 

The overall premium indication is USD 13,500 (100% RI support ).

 

USD 5,000 of the above premium will be assigned to a Minimum and Deposit Premium in relation to armoured Transits, which will be adjustable at a premium rate of 0.035% on annual turnover. This also includes USD 200,000 any one loss, any one entrustment limit, with a built-in provision to increase this limit to USD 2 million for Royal Family entrustments based on a premium rate of 0.15% per entrustment but subject to prior agreement by Underwriters.

 

For full clarity, any entrusted goods must be from the stock sum insured at retail locations we are covering, unless otherwise agreed by underwriters, and based on a written consignment agreement which specifies who is responsible for the goods and when they should be returned.

Dear Kevork,

Please find the requested details below:

 

*	Are there any more locations that has Chalhoub exposure? If so, do these also require cover? 

	*	No

*	On what basis is Chalhoub Group responsible for insuring these locations? The locations are well known brands i.e. Saks/Repossi that would normally insure through their own programme? Please can you confirm why the stores are not covering the jewellery?

*	When the jewellery is being entrusted to members of the Royal Family, without a Chalhoub representative, are the entrustments being sent from one of the below detailed Named Locations, or from a separate location? What is the maximum value of the jewellery being entrusted to the Royal Family at any one time. In addition, are there written consignment agreements in place?

Kindly note that our team in London had several  initial conversations with insurers, and some questions have been raised. For full clarity, insurers are aware that there are time constraints both on Chalhoub
Group which are naturally cascaded down to Marsh.

 

Please see below questions and comments for you much appreciate consideration and support :

 

*	Are there any more locations that has Chalhoub exposure? If so, do these also require cover?
*	On what basis is Chalhoub Group responsible for insuring these locations? The locations are well known brands i.e. Saks/Repossi that would normally insure through their own programme? Please can you confirm why the stores are not covering the jewellery?
*	When the jewellery is being entrusted to members of the Royal Family, without a Chalhoub representative, are the entrustments being sent from one of the below detailed Named Locations, or from a separate location? What is the maximum value of the jewellery being entrusted to the Royal Family at any one time. In addition, are there written consignment agreements in place?
*	Please can you confirm the annual transit turnover? What firm will be undertaking the transits?
*	At what point will this Jewellery Block policy be on risk for the transits? Would we be covering the jewellery at the moment it arrives in the Middle East, or are international transits also covered?

What is the maximum value of the jewellery being entrusted to the Royal Family at any one time. In addition, are there written consignment agreements in place?
*	Please can you confirm the annual transit turnover? What firm will be undertaking the transits?
*	At what point will this Jewellery Block policy be on risk for the transits? Would we be covering the jewellery at the moment it arrives in the Middle East, or are international transits also covered?

 

In addition, and to manage expectations, insurer  would not be able to offer the selling price as the Basis of Valuation. Would replacement cost be sufficient, which is the Basis of Valuation that Chalhoub’s peers operate on?

 

We are happy to jump on a call at any point in time if you have any questions or comments and look forward to hearing from you soon .

 

Kind regards,

Kev

Please find below the additional details required :

 

*       Stock to be Insured Based on Sales Price

o   UAE: USD 6,000,000

o   KSA: USD 2,000,000

o   Bahrain: USD 1,000,000

*       Locations Requiring Coverage

o   UAE

*  Dubai Mall – De Beers

*  Galleria Mall – Repossi

o   KSA

*  Kingdom Mall – Repossi

o   Bahrain

*  Bahrain City Center – Multibrand (located within our department store, Saks Fifth Avenue - BCC)

*       Minimum Security and Fire Protections at Each Location

o   Fire Safety:

*  Smoke detectors

*  Sprinkler systems covering all areas

*  Fire-rated materials installed per civil defence guidelines (compliant)

o   Maintenance:

*  Routine maintenance for electrical systems, firefighting (FF), and HVAC

o   Security:

*  Dedicated security personnel during business hours

*  Mall security outside of business hours

*  Full CCTV coverage

*  Intrusion alarms

*       Value of Items Transported Outside the Store

o   Amount: USD 50,000 to USD 200,000 per client, depending on the sales price

*       Transit Coverage Requirements

o   Local Transit:

*  Coverage up to USD 2,000,000 (based on sales price)

*  Preferably with a minimum premium and an adjustable premium based on actual imported values

*       Additional Coverage Details

o   Shoplifting Protection

o   Consignment Goods:

*  In Bahrain, we sell other jewelry brands based on a consignment agreement model. The same model applies to UAE and KSA.

*  Potential future consignment sales at Level Shoes District in Dubai Mall (confirmation pending)

o   Exclusions:

*  Potential future consignment sales at Level Shoes District in Dubai Mall (confirmation pending)

o   Exclusions:

*  No coverage required for KSA

*  No Fidelity insurance needed (covered separately)

o   Special Circumstances:

*  Coverage for sending jewelry to royals and while in possession of representatives under pre-agreed ad-hoc terms, including:

*  Minimum security requirements

*  Coverage duration limitations

*  Procedural requirements

*       Note

o   Currently, there is no requirement for jewelry insurance in Kuwait. However, this may change in the future.

 

A full list of entity names, related documents, and KYC requirements will be provided upon finalization of the agreement.

 

Please provide a quotation by early next week so we can discuss further as needed and finalize.

From: Kechichian, Kevork <Kevork.Kechichian@marsh.com <mailto:Kevork.Kechichian@marsh.com> >

To: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Kapoor, Puja <Puja.Kapoor@marsh.com <mailto:Puja.Kapoor@marsh.com> >
Subject: RE: JB Proposal Form
Importance: High

 

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

Dear Hagop ,

 

I hope you’re well . It was great speaking with you yesterday .

 

As per the London Specie Team’s request could you kindly confirm the following ?

 

*	The limits of liability required by  the group(all regions )
*	A full list of the locations that require cover.
*	The minimum security and fire protections at the locations – including at day time and night time.
*	Confirmation of the value being taken outside the store when the Insured’s representatives show items at the clients residences.
*	 Confirmation of any transit cover that is required.
*	Further details about the items that require cover.

 

When we have this information, we can discuss further, and maybe setup another call?

 

We look forward to hearing from you soon .

 

Kind regards,

Kev

We also attach the updated slip for your review and comments .

 

Looking forward to hearing from you in order to finalize .

Best regards, 

Kev

 

We have spoken with insurers, and now provided an updated quote slip for your review. 

 

Firstly, the Basis of Valuation cannot be amended to be Retail Sales Price. The core principle of insurance is to restore the insured to their financial position prior to the loss, not to provide a profit. Insuring Chalhoub’s jewellery at retail price can lead to over-insurance, where the payout exceeds the actual value of the item. Insuring at retail price could result in the insured receiving more than what they lost, which is contrary to the principle of indemnity. This Basis of Valuation is not possible in the insurance market. 

 

Secondly, we have amended the limit for Location 2 to USD 2,000,000 and similarly amended the Static Premium to USD 6,720 (100%) in full per annum, which amend the Total Premium Due at Inception to USD 15,220 (100%) in full per annum. 

 

Thirdly, insurers require that the Minimum and Deposit premium of USD 5,000 remains as stated in the initial quotation. 

 

Finally, the Exhibition limit needs to be aggregated in the policy. If the Insured requires additional static cover, they can purchase more limit at the same rate of 0.03% subject to prior agreement by lead underwriters.

From your previous exhibition history, it looks as though Chalhoub undertake 3 exhibitions a year of that value. Insurers are willing to provide cover for these exhibitions and provided two options. Option 1 – static cover only at an Additional Premium of USD 450. Option 2 – static cover and armoured transit cover at an Additional Premium of USD 600. 

 

However, in respect of exhibitions, we must receive confirmation that during the exhibitions the jewellery will be maintained within the following guidelines:

1.	Never be left unattended, for any reason whatsoever, whilst on display during Exhibition hours
2.	At all times be kept in locked showcases, cabinets, drawers and/or safes whilst on display during Exhibition hours, unless being removed or returned to such showcases, drawers and/or safes.
3.	Be kept in a locked safe/vault or approved security room at all times when not being displayed. 

 

I know the Insured is actively chasing for a formal quotation, but as this is a new risk to the Market, we need to get this correct. Please note we hope to have something concrete with you shortly.

Please find below the additional details required :

 

*       Stock to be Insured Based on Sales Price

o   UAE: USD 6,000,000

o   KSA: USD 2,000,000

o   Bahrain: USD 1,000,000

*       Locations Requiring Coverage

o   UAE

*  Dubai Mall – De Beers

*  Galleria Mall – Repossi

o   KSA

*  Kingdom Mall – Repossi

o   Bahrain

*  Bahrain City Center – Multibrand (located within our department store, Saks Fifth Avenue - BCC)

*       Minimum Security and Fire Protections at Each Location

o   Fire Safety:

*  Smoke detectors

*  Sprinkler systems covering all areas

*  Fire-rated materials installed per civil defence guidelines (compliant)

o   Maintenance:

*  Routine maintenance for electrical systems, firefighting (FF), and HVAC

o   Security:

*  Dedicated security personnel during business hours

*  Mall security outside of business hours

*  Full CCTV coverage

*  Intrusion alarms

*       Value of Items Transported Outside the Store

o   Amount: USD 50,000 to USD 200,000 per client, depending on the sales price

*       Transit Coverage Requirements

o   Local Transit:

*  Coverage up to USD 2,000,000 (based on sales price)

*  Preferably with a minimum premium and an adjustable premium based on actual imported values

*       Additional Coverage Details

o   Shoplifting Protection

o   Consignment Goods:

*  In Bahrain, we sell other jewelry brands based on a consignment agreement model. The same model applies to UAE and KSA.

*  Potential future consignment sales at Level Shoes District in Dubai Mall (confirmation pending)

o   Exclusions:

*  In Bahrain, we sell other jewelry brands based on a consignment agreement model. The same model applies to UAE and KSA.

*  Potential future consignment sales at Level Shoes District in Dubai Mall (confirmation pending)

o   Exclusions:

*  No coverage required for KSA

*  No Fidelity insurance needed (covered separately)

o   Special Circumstances:

*  Coverage for sending jewelry to royals and while in possession of representatives under pre-agreed ad-hoc terms, including:

*  Minimum security requirements

*  Coverage duration limitations

*  Procedural requirements

*       Note

o   Currently, there is no requirement for jewelry insurance in Kuwait. However, this may change in the future.

 

A full list of entity names, related documents, and KYC requirements will be provided upon finalization of the agreement.

 

Please provide a quotation by early next week so we can discuss further as needed and finalize.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

Dear Hagop ,

 

I hope you’re well . It was great speaking with you yesterday .

 

As per the London Specie Team’s request could you kindly confirm the following ?

 

*	The limits of liability required by  the group(all regions )
*	A full list of the locations that require cover.
*	The minimum security and fire protections at the locations – including at day time and night time.
*	Confirmation of the value being taken outside the store when the Insured’s representatives show items at the clients residences.
*	 Confirmation of any transit cover that is required.
*	Further details about the items that require cover.

 

When we have this information, we can discuss further, and maybe setup another call?

 

We look forward to hearing from you soon .

 

Kind regards,

Kev

If You are an individual client, by accepting this business proposal You are entering into, and agree to be bound by, the Agreement from the date of such acceptance. Where You act on behalf of a legal entity, by accepting this business proposal You confirm that (i) You are duly authorized to enter into this Agreement by the legal entity on whose behalf You issue Your instructions to Us (“Authorized Representative”), and (ii) You accept the Agreement on behalf of such legal entity and agree to be bound by it from the date of Your acceptance of this business proposal. 

 

In the event You do not accept this business proposal by the means outlined in the preceding sentence, however you continue to instruct Us on the basis of the business proposal, We will deem your acceptance of this business proposal and the terms contained herein. Further, we will understand that you are the Authorized Representative, unless You advise us otherwise.

 

DISCLOSURE OF MATERIAL FACTS - Every proposer or insured when seeking new insurance or renewing an existing policy must disclose any information which might influence the insurer in deciding whether or not to accept the risk, what the terms should be, or what premiums to charge. Failure to do so may render the insurance voidable from inception and enable the insurer to repudiate liability

Dear Kevork,

 

Thank you so much for your call today.

 

As discussed, MDP for the cargo insurance is very high. We would need to have USD 14,000,000 annual turnover based on cost value to consume the MDP which is unrealistic. 

 

The total retail value of the insured products declared is USD 11M. If we were to sell everything, the estimated cost to replace the sold products would be approximately USD 5.5M. Given these figures, the MDP of USD 5,000 is not be justified.

 

Let us please conclude this exercise and have cover in place with the below amendments to the latest proposal:

We also attach the updated slip for your review and comments .

 

Looking forward to hearing from you in order to finalize .

Best regards, 

Kev

 

We have spoken with insurers, and now provided an updated quote slip for your review. 

 

Firstly, the Basis of Valuation cannot be amended to be Retail Sales Price. The core principle of insurance is to restore the insured to their financial position prior to the loss, not to provide a profit. Insuring Chalhoub’s jewellery at retail price can lead to over-insurance, where the payout exceeds the actual value of the item. Insuring at retail price could result in the insured receiving more than what they lost, which is contrary to the principle of indemnity. This Basis of Valuation is not possible in the insurance market. 

 

Secondly, we have amended the limit for Location 2 to USD 2,000,000 and similarly amended the Static Premium to USD 6,720 (100%) in full per annum, which amend the Total Premium Due at Inception to USD 15,220 (100%) in full per annum. 

 

Thirdly, insurers require that the Minimum and Deposit premium of USD 5,000 remains as stated in the initial quotation. 

 

Finally, the Exhibition limit needs to be aggregated in the policy. If the Insured requires additional static cover, they can purchase more limit at the same rate of 0.03% subject to prior agreement by lead underwriters.

PREMIUM

And although the policy allows for an Exhibition limit of USD 1,500,000 and USD 5,000,000 in the annual aggregate, any additional Exhibitions are to be adjusted at a rate of 0.09%.

In addition, any Celebrity , VIP or  Royal Family entrustments are to be adjusted at a rate of 0.15%. And although the policy allows for an Exhibition limit of USD 1,500,000 and USD 5,000,000 in the annual aggregate, any additional Exhibitions are to be adjusted at a rate of 0.09%.

 

MARKET SELECTION

We approached several  lead carrier for terms and  Tokio Marine Kiln was the most competitive with follow markets’ share stated in attached RI slip .

This lead market was selected based upon the following criteria: competitive pricing / claims service / access to capacity / commercially responsive / sector knowledge.

 

MARSH UK COMPENSATION AND PLACEMENT STATEMENT  

Please see Marsh Compensation and Placement Description document (MCPD)  attached for full descriptions of the terms in bold below.

 

Placement:

This placement or part thereof is placed under a Lineslip.

 

LIMIT(S) / RETENTION(S)

The Limit(s) / Retention(s) provided are detailed in the attached quote.

 

SUBJECTIVITIES / IMPORTANT TERMS

Whilst we recommend that you review the attached quotation in full, we would like to draw your attention to the following.

 

The Basis of Valuation is as follows:

*	For the Insured’s Own Stock is Cost Price plus 10% or Replacement Value whichever is the highest.
*	For Goods given on Approval is Entrustment Note Value for entrustments to/by the assured.
*	For Goods sold is Selling Price for goods sold but not delivered.

Dear Hagop,

 

I hope you are well .

 

Please find the below comments/query from our London Team .

 

We count on your understanding and look forward to receiving your final in order to obtain and formal binding indication from the RI market .

 

Kindest regards,

Kev

 

 

Apologies for this taking some time – for completely new risks into the London Market there is a process to make sure all everything is underwritten correctly.  

 

I know in your previous email you raised that some celebrities are entrusted items for events etc. The insurer needs to know about the values given to these celebrities – will this be on the same basis as the entrustments, i.e. USD 200k? In addition, would there be any overnight exposure, and will this only be in KSA, UAE and Bahrain?

I know in your previous email you raised that some celebrities are entrusted items for events etc. The insurer needs to know about the values given to these celebrities – will this be on the same basis as the entrustments, i.e. USD 200k? In addition, would there be any overnight exposure, and will this only be in KSA, UAE and Bahrain?  

 

In addition, in your previous email you mentioned that for home visits and for exhibitions where values less than USD 1.5M (retail) will be exhibited, the products are generally transferred by the brand director or relevant employees. For personal conveyances of this scale, there would be an Additional Premium of USD 2,000, and require two people in attendance, one being the brand director plus an experienced member of staff.

 

In respect of the exhibitions, would a limit of USD 500,000, and USD 1.5 million in the annual aggregate be sufficient? From your previous exhibition history, it looks as though Chalhoub undertake 3 exhibitions a year of that value. Insurers are willing to provide cover for these exhibitions and provided two options. Option 1 – static cover only at an Additional Premium of USD 450. Option 2 – static cover and armoured transit cover at an Additional Premium of USD 600. 

 

However, in respect of exhibitions, we must receive confirmation that during the exhibitions the jewellery will be maintained within the following guidelines:

In respect of the exhibitions, would a limit of USD 500,000, and USD 1.5 million in the annual aggregate be sufficient? From your previous exhibition history, it looks as though Chalhoub undertake 3 exhibitions a year of that value. Insurers are willing to provide cover for these exhibitions and provided two options. Option 1 – static cover only at an Additional Premium of USD 450. Option 2 – static cover and armoured transit cover at an Additional Premium of USD 600. 

 

However, in respect of exhibitions, we must receive confirmation that during the exhibitions the jewellery will be maintained within the following guidelines:

1.	Never be left unattended, for any reason whatsoever, whilst on display during Exhibition hours
2.	At all times be kept in locked showcases, cabinets, drawers and/or safes whilst on display during Exhibition hours, unless being removed or returned to such showcases, drawers and/or safes.
3.	Be kept in a locked safe/vault or approved security room at all times when not being displayed. 

 

I know the Insured is actively chasing for a formal quotation, but as this is a new risk to the Market, we need to get this correct. Please note we hope to have something concrete with you shortly.

Dear Hagop ,

 

We hope you are well .

 

Based in our earlier conversation today , We are pleased to confirm  that we now have received a very rough indication from insurers for Jeweler’s Block cover as per below  details :

 

The overall premium indication is USD 13,500 (100% RI support ).

 

USD 5,000 of the above premium will be assigned to a Minimum and Deposit Premium in relation to armoured Transits, which will be adjustable at a premium rate of 0.035% on annual turnover. This also includes USD 200,000 any one loss, any one entrustment limit, with a built-in provision to increase this limit to USD 2 million for Royal Family entrustments based on a premium rate of 0.15% per entrustment but subject to prior agreement by Underwriters.

Dear Hagop ,

 

I hope you’re well . It was great speaking with you yesterday .

 

As per the London Specie Team’s request could you kindly confirm the following ?

 

*	The limits of liability required by  the group(all regions )
*	A full list of the locations that require cover.
*	The minimum security and fire protections at the locations – including at day time and night time.
*	Confirmation of the value being taken outside the store when the Insured’s representatives show items at the clients residences.
*	 Confirmation of any transit cover that is required.
*	Further details about the items that require cover.

 

When we have this information, we can discuss further, and maybe setup another call?

 

We look forward to hearing from you soon .

 

Kind regards,

Kev

Dear Kevork,

 

Thank you so much for your call today.

 

As discussed, MDP for the cargo insurance is very high. We would need to have USD 14,000,000 annual turnover based on cost value to consume the MDP which is unrealistic. 

 

The total retail value of the insured products declared is USD 11M. If we were to sell everything, the estimated cost to replace the sold products would be approximately USD 5.5M. Given these figures, the MDP of USD 5,000 is not be justified.

 

Let us please conclude this exercise and have cover in place with the below amendments to the latest proposal:

The total retail value of the insured products declared is USD 11M. If we were to sell everything, the estimated cost to replace the sold products would be approximately USD 5.5M. Given these figures, the MDP of USD 5,000 is not be justified.

 

Let us please conclude this exercise and have cover in place with the below amendments to the latest proposal:

 

*	MDP for Sendings: USD 3,000 (instead of USD 5,000) 
*	Valuation provisions: 

	*	Insured’s Own Stock: Cost Price + 20% or Replacement Value, whichever is higher (instead of Cost Price + 10%)
	*	Sendings: Cost Price + 20% or Replacement Value, whichever is higher (instead of Cost Price + 10%)

*	All other terms as per the latest proposal

 

You may proceed and bind cover effective Feb 1, 2025 subject to the above amendments.

 

Thank you once again for your kind support.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

I hope you’re well.

chunks.text:
We also attach the updated slip for your review and comments .

 

Looking forward to hearing from you in order to finalize .

Best regards, 

Kev

 

We have spoken with insurers, and now provided an updated quote slip for your review. 

 

Firstly, the Basis of Valuation cannot be amended to be Retail Sales Price. The core principle of insurance is to restore the insured to their financial position prior to the loss, not to provide a profit. Insuring Chalhoub’s jewellery at retail price can lead to over-insurance, where the payout exceeds the actual value of the item. Insuring at retail price could result in the insured receiving more than what they lost, which is contrary to the principle of indemnity. This Basis of Valuation is not possible in the insurance market. 

 

Secondly, we have amended the limit for Location 2 to USD 2,000,000 and similarly amended the Static Premium to USD 6,720 (100%) in full per annum, which amend the Total Premium Due at Inception to USD 15,220 (100%) in full per annum. 

 

Thirdly, insurers require that the Minimum and Deposit premium of USD 5,000 remains as stated in the initial quotation. 

 

Finally, the Exhibition limit needs to be aggregated in the policy. If the Insured requires additional static cover, they can purchase more limit at the same rate of 0.03% subject to prior agreement by lead underwriters.

*	For Goods given on Approval is Entrustment Note Value for entrustments to/by the assured.
*	For Goods sold is Selling Price for goods sold but not delivered.

I know in your previous email you raised that some celebrities are entrusted items for events etc. The insurer needs to know about the values given to these celebrities – will this be on the same basis as the entrustments, i.e. USD 200k? In addition, would there be any overnight exposure, and will this only be in KSA, UAE and Bahrain?  

 

In addition, in your previous email you mentioned that for home visits and for exhibitions where values less than USD 1.5M (retail) will be exhibited, the products are generally transferred by the brand director or relevant employees. For personal conveyances of this scale, there would be an Additional Premium of USD 2,000, and require two people in attendance, one being the brand director plus an experienced member of staff.

 

In respect of the exhibitions, would a limit of USD 500,000, and USD 1.5 million in the annual aggregate be sufficient? From your previous exhibition history, it looks as though Chalhoub undertake 3 exhibitions a year of that value. Insurers are willing to provide cover for these exhibitions and provided two options. Option 1 – static cover only at an Additional Premium of USD 450. Option 2 – static cover and armoured transit cover at an Additional Premium of USD 600. 

 

However, in respect of exhibitions, we must receive confirmation that during the exhibitions the jewellery will be maintained within the following guidelines:

In respect of the exhibitions, would a limit of USD 500,000, and USD 1.5 million in the annual aggregate be sufficient? From your previous exhibition history, it looks as though Chalhoub undertake 3 exhibitions a year of that value. Insurers are willing to provide cover for these exhibitions and provided two options. Option 1 – static cover only at an Additional Premium of USD 450. Option 2 – static cover and armoured transit cover at an Additional Premium of USD 600. 

 

However, in respect of exhibitions, we must receive confirmation that during the exhibitions the jewellery will be maintained within the following guidelines:

1.	Never be left unattended, for any reason whatsoever, whilst on display during Exhibition hours
2.	At all times be kept in locked showcases, cabinets, drawers and/or safes whilst on display during Exhibition hours, unless being removed or returned to such showcases, drawers and/or safes.
3.	Be kept in a locked safe/vault or approved security room at all times when not being displayed. 

 

I know the Insured is actively chasing for a formal quotation, but as this is a new risk to the Market, we need to get this correct. Please note we hope to have something concrete with you shortly.

chunks.text:
Kindly note that our team in London had several  initial conversations with insurers, and some questions have been raised. For full clarity, insurers are aware that there are time constraints both on Chalhoub
Group which are naturally cascaded down to Marsh.

 

Please see below questions and comments for you much appreciate consideration and support :

 

*	Are there any more locations that has Chalhoub exposure? If so, do these also require cover?
*	On what basis is Chalhoub Group responsible for insuring these locations? The locations are well known brands i.e. Saks/Repossi that would normally insure through their own programme? Please can you confirm why the stores are not covering the jewellery?
*	When the jewellery is being entrusted to members of the Royal Family, without a Chalhoub representative, are the entrustments being sent from one of the below detailed Named Locations, or from a separate location? What is the maximum value of the jewellery being entrusted to the Royal Family at any one time. In addition, are there written consignment agreements in place?
*	Please can you confirm the annual transit turnover? What firm will be undertaking the transits?
*	At what point will this Jewellery Block policy be on risk for the transits? Would we be covering the jewellery at the moment it arrives in the Middle East, or are international transits also covered?

What is the maximum value of the jewellery being entrusted to the Royal Family at any one time. In addition, are there written consignment agreements in place?
*	Please can you confirm the annual transit turnover? What firm will be undertaking the transits?
*	At what point will this Jewellery Block policy be on risk for the transits? Would we be covering the jewellery at the moment it arrives in the Middle East, or are international transits also covered?

 

In addition, and to manage expectations, insurer  would not be able to offer the selling price as the Basis of Valuation. Would replacement cost be sufficient, which is the Basis of Valuation that Chalhoub’s peers operate on?

 

We are happy to jump on a call at any point in time if you have any questions or comments and look forward to hearing from you soon .

 

Kind regards,

Kev

o   Security:

*  Dedicated security personnel during business hours

*  Mall security outside of business hours

*  Full CCTV coverage

*  Intrusion alarms

o   Amount: USD 50,000 to USD 200,000 per client, depending on the sales price

*       Transit Coverage Requirements

o   Local Transit:

*  Coverage up to USD 2,000,000 (based on sales price)

*  Preferably with a minimum premium and an adjustable premium based on actual imported values

*       Additional Coverage Details

o   Shoplifting Protection

o   Consignment Goods:

We also attach the updated slip for your review and comments .

 

Looking forward to hearing from you in order to finalize .

Best regards, 

Kev

 

We have spoken with insurers, and now provided an updated quote slip for your review. 

 

Firstly, the Basis of Valuation cannot be amended to be Retail Sales Price. The core principle of insurance is to restore the insured to their financial position prior to the loss, not to provide a profit. Insuring Chalhoub’s jewellery at retail price can lead to over-insurance, where the payout exceeds the actual value of the item. Insuring at retail price could result in the insured receiving more than what they lost, which is contrary to the principle of indemnity. This Basis of Valuation is not possible in the insurance market. 

 

Secondly, we have amended the limit for Location 2 to USD 2,000,000 and similarly amended the Static Premium to USD 6,720 (100%) in full per annum, which amend the Total Premium Due at Inception to USD 15,220 (100%) in full per annum. 

 

Thirdly, insurers require that the Minimum and Deposit premium of USD 5,000 remains as stated in the initial quotation. 

 

Finally, the Exhibition limit needs to be aggregated in the policy. If the Insured requires additional static cover, they can purchase more limit at the same rate of 0.03% subject to prior agreement by lead underwriters.

Dear Hagop ,

 

We hope you are well .

 

Based in our earlier conversation today , We are pleased to confirm  that we now have received a very rough indication from insurers for Jeweler’s Block cover as per below  details :

 

The overall premium indication is USD 13,500 (100% RI support ).

 

USD 5,000 of the above premium will be assigned to a Minimum and Deposit Premium in relation to armoured Transits, which will be adjustable at a premium rate of 0.035% on annual turnover. This also includes USD 200,000 any one loss, any one entrustment limit, with a built-in provision to increase this limit to USD 2 million for Royal Family entrustments based on a premium rate of 0.15% per entrustment but subject to prior agreement by Underwriters.

Dear Hagop ,

 

I hope you’re well . It was great speaking with you yesterday .

 

As per the London Specie Team’s request could you kindly confirm the following ?

 

*	The limits of liability required by  the group(all regions )
*	A full list of the locations that require cover.
*	The minimum security and fire protections at the locations – including at day time and night time.
*	Confirmation of the value being taken outside the store when the Insured’s representatives show items at the clients residences.
*	 Confirmation of any transit cover that is required.
*	Further details about the items that require cover.

 

When we have this information, we can discuss further, and maybe setup another call?

 

We look forward to hearing from you soon .

 

Kind regards,

Kev

Dear Puja,

 

Please find attached all the necessary documents for MCT FZE's KYC requirements. The passport details for the relevant individuals are included. Emirates ID copies are not provided, as passport information is typically sufficient.

 

Both the JB and PV can be issued under the billing entity of MCT FZE. However, for the JB, please ensure that "Michel Chalhoub Trading LLC" is mentioned as the insured party. For the group policy, you may include "Chalhoub Group Retail and/or subsidiaries and/or associated companies" as the insured entity.

 

Additionally, please provide the bank details, TRN, and TL for the fronting company or insurer to facilitate supplier creation in our internal system? This step is essential to process the payment.

 

Thank you for your assistance.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

We also attach the updated slip for your review and comments .

 

Looking forward to hearing from you in order to finalize .

Best regards, 

Kev

 

We have spoken with insurers, and now provided an updated quote slip for your review. 

 

Firstly, the Basis of Valuation cannot be amended to be Retail Sales Price. The core principle of insurance is to restore the insured to their financial position prior to the loss, not to provide a profit. Insuring Chalhoub’s jewellery at retail price can lead to over-insurance, where the payout exceeds the actual value of the item. Insuring at retail price could result in the insured receiving more than what they lost, which is contrary to the principle of indemnity. This Basis of Valuation is not possible in the insurance market. 

 

Secondly, we have amended the limit for Location 2 to USD 2,000,000 and similarly amended the Static Premium to USD 6,720 (100%) in full per annum, which amend the Total Premium Due at Inception to USD 15,220 (100%) in full per annum. 

 

Thirdly, insurers require that the Minimum and Deposit premium of USD 5,000 remains as stated in the initial quotation. 

 

Finally, the Exhibition limit needs to be aggregated in the policy. If the Insured requires additional static cover, they can purchase more limit at the same rate of 0.03% subject to prior agreement by lead underwriters.

Sent: Monday, November 25, 2024 2:35 PM
To: 'Hagop Ghazarian' <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >

Subject: RE: JB Proposal Form

 

Dear Hagop ,

 

We hope you are well .

 

Based in our earlier conversation today , We are pleased to confirm  that we now have received a very rough indication from insurers for Jeweler’s Block cover as per below  details :

 

The overall premium indication is USD 13,500 (100% RI support ).

 

USD 5,000 of the above premium will be assigned to a Minimum and Deposit Premium in relation to armoured Transits, which will be adjustable at a premium rate of 0.035% on annual turnover. This also includes USD 200,000 any one loss, any one entrustment limit, with a built-in provision to increase this limit to USD 2 million for Royal Family entrustments based on a premium rate of 0.15% per entrustment but subject to prior agreement by Underwriters.

USD 5,000 of the above premium will be assigned to a Minimum and Deposit Premium in relation to armoured Transits, which will be adjustable at a premium rate of 0.035% on annual turnover. This also includes USD 200,000 any one loss, any one entrustment limit, with a built-in provision to increase this limit to USD 2 million for Royal Family entrustments based on a premium rate of 0.15% per entrustment but subject to prior agreement by Underwriters.

 

For full clarity, any entrusted goods must be from the stock sum insured at retail locations we are covering, unless otherwise agreed by underwriters, and based on a written consignment agreement which specifies who is responsible for the goods and when they should be returned.

 

If this indication is of interest, please let us know and we will provide a formal quotation A.S.AP.

 

Thank you and kind regards,

 

Kev

	*	No existing consignment agreements in place or even expected for the time being.

	*	Ferrari Logistics. Let us declare USD 5,000,000 (retail value) with 75% MDP paid upfront and adjusted as per the actuals. The reason for the lower estimate is because the incoterms are not consistent and we have everything from Ex-works to DDP when it comes to Jewellery shipments. For the renewal, we will have more clarity and confidence on the estimates.    

*	At what point will this Jewellery Block policy be on risk for the transits? Would we be covering the jewellery at the moment it arrives in the Middle East, or are international transits also covered? 

	*	International transit from the moment of leaving the supplier and recovery can be made from the supplier if possible based on the incoterms.

 

Remain at your disposal for any further details required.


Best Regards,

Hagop 

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

Kindly note that our team in London had several  initial conversations with insurers, and some questions have been raised. For full clarity, insurers are aware that there are time constraints both on Chalhoub
Group which are naturally cascaded down to Marsh.

 

Please see below questions and comments for you much appreciate consideration and support :

 

*	Are there any more locations that has Chalhoub exposure? If so, do these also require cover?
*	On what basis is Chalhoub Group responsible for insuring these locations? The locations are well known brands i.e. Saks/Repossi that would normally insure through their own programme? Please can you confirm why the stores are not covering the jewellery?
*	When the jewellery is being entrusted to members of the Royal Family, without a Chalhoub representative, are the entrustments being sent from one of the below detailed Named Locations, or from a separate location? What is the maximum value of the jewellery being entrusted to the Royal Family at any one time. In addition, are there written consignment agreements in place?
*	Please can you confirm the annual transit turnover? What firm will be undertaking the transits?
*	At what point will this Jewellery Block policy be on risk for the transits? Would we be covering the jewellery at the moment it arrives in the Middle East, or are international transits also covered?

Please find below the additional details required :

 

*       Stock to be Insured Based on Sales Price

o   UAE: USD 6,000,000

o   KSA: USD 2,000,000

o   Bahrain: USD 1,000,000

*       Locations Requiring Coverage

o   UAE

*  Dubai Mall – De Beers

*  Galleria Mall – Repossi

o   KSA

*  Kingdom Mall – Repossi

o   Bahrain

*  Bahrain City Center – Multibrand (located within our department store, Saks Fifth Avenue - BCC)

*       Minimum Security and Fire Protections at Each Location

o   Fire Safety:

*  Smoke detectors

*  Sprinkler systems covering all areas

*  Fire-rated materials installed per civil defence guidelines (compliant)

o   Maintenance:

*  Routine maintenance for electrical systems, firefighting (FF), and HVAC

o   Security:

*  Dedicated security personnel during business hours

*  Mall security outside of business hours

*  Full CCTV coverage

*  Intrusion alarms

*       Value of Items Transported Outside the Store

o   Amount: USD 50,000 to USD 200,000 per client, depending on the sales price

*       Transit Coverage Requirements

o   Local Transit:

*  Coverage up to USD 2,000,000 (based on sales price)

*  Preferably with a minimum premium and an adjustable premium based on actual imported values

*       Additional Coverage Details

o   Shoplifting Protection

o   Consignment Goods:

*  In Bahrain, we sell other jewelry brands based on a consignment agreement model. The same model applies to UAE and KSA.

*  Potential future consignment sales at Level Shoes District in Dubai Mall (confirmation pending)

o   Exclusions:

o   Currently, there is no requirement for jewelry insurance in Kuwait. However, this may change in the future.

In the event You do not accept this business proposal by the means outlined in the preceding sentence, however you continue to instruct Us on the basis of the business proposal, We will deem your acceptance of this business proposal and the terms contained herein.
